prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desiree DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. [info] 

To the Security at Lordly Tailor.

I will be coming to purloin the most
priceless work of art on display in
your "Treasures of Kurain" exhibit.

Take good care of the speckled urn, won't you...?

Yours truly,
Mask DeMasque
Pearl:
Um, these cute little pink splotches... They said that it's paint... And that they were put on the urn recently!
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. [info] 

Blackmail Letter

If you don't want your true
identity revealed to the world,
come to KB security at 1:00 AM
on October 12th and bring
$50,000.

If you don't, I'll take that red diamond you received the other day instead. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card → CEO Office Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: The urn was placed in a box, and Zvarri! It was then sent to the warehouse.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime...
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 5
Testimony: At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to figure this out. The user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The case involves a theft of the Sacred Urn and the murder of Kane Bullard. The key here is to look for inconsistencies between the provided evidence and the testimonies given by the characters.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see if there's an evidence that conflicts with it.

Looking at Testimony 4 by Atmey: "I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!" If Atmey claims he handled security himself, that would mean he was in control. However, Evidence 12 (Key Card) mentions that Ron's wallet had a key card used to access the CEO's office on the night of the crime at 1 AM. Also, Evidence 19 (Buzzer Record) says the buzzer was used at 1:02 AM, which might indicate someone else was there. But maybe that's not directly conflicting.

Wait, Testimony 5 says, "At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th." The Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches. But according to Evidence 22 (Paint Marks), the paint was already dry when Adrian dropped the urn's box two weeks prior. If the paint was already dry before the crime, then the pink splotches on the urn couldn't have been made recently by Atmey at the time he claims he first touched it. That would mean the splotches were there before, contradicting his statement that he first held it at 1 AM when the paint would have been dry. Wait, but the testimony is about holding it for the first time, but the paint was already there. Hmm, maybe that's a contradiction.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 2: "Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime..." If he couldn't see it until the day of the crime, but Evidence 4 says the urn was found in his office with pink splotches. The Paint Marks (Evidence 22) mention Adrian dropped the urn's box two weeks ago, causing paint to spill. If the paint was already on the box and the urn when it was moved, then Atmey would have seen the paint when he first handled it, contradicting his claim that he couldn't see it until the crime day. Wait, but the urn was in a box. If the box had paint stains (Evidence 21: Urn Box has pink stains), then when Atmey handled the box before, he would have noticed the stains. But he says he couldn't see the urn until the day of the crime. However, the urn was in a box sent to the warehouse, so maybe he didn't open it until then. But the paint marks on the urn itself would have been there from when Adrian dropped it two weeks prior, so if Atmey first touched the urn at 1 AM, the splotches were already there, so that's consistent. Maybe not the contradiction.

Wait, another angle: Evidence 4 says the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. If Atmey is the thief, then that's consistent. But his testimony (Testimony 4) says he handled security himself to ensure his crime went smoothly. So he's admitting to the theft? Wait, but the case is about Kane's murder. Wait, the problem might be with the timing. Testimony 5 says he first held the urn at 1 AM on October 12th. The Autopsy Report (Evidence 15) says Kane's time of death was 10/12 at 1 AM. So if Atmey was handling the urn at the exact time of the murder, maybe there's a conflict if the evidence shows he couldn't have been there. But I'm not sure.

Looking at Evidence 7 (Camera Data): warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM. Evidence 9 (Security Camera Photo) might show someone else. But maybe not directly conflicting.

Wait, Testimony 4 says he handled security himself. But Evidence 12's key card was found in Ron's wallet, and used on 10/12 at 1 AM. If Atmey was handling security, why was Ron's key card used? Maybe that's a contradiction. If Atmey was in control, but the key card used was Ron's, implying Ron was there, conflicting with Atmey's claim of handling it himself.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says he handled security himself to ensure his crime went smoothly. But if the key card used was Ron's, that suggests Ron was involved, contradicting Atmey's solo claim. So the contradiction would be between Evidence 12 (Key Card) and Testimony 4. But the user wants only one pair, so which is more direct?

Alternatively, Testimony 5 says he first held the urn at 1 AM. Evidence 4 says the urn was found in his office. But if the urn was already in his office before that time, then his testimony is wrong. But when was the urn found? The description says it was found in Atmey's office, so perhaps he placed it there after stealing it at 1 AM. So that's consistent. Hmm.

Another point: Evidence 22 says the paint was completely dry when Adrian dropped the box two weeks ago. The Sacred Urn's pink splotches (Evidence 4) were from that incident. So when Atmey first touched the urn at 1 AM, the paint was already dry. But if the splotches were recent, that would contradict. But the evidence says the paint was already dry, so maybe that's not conflicting.

Wait, maybe Testimony 3: "I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand." If the card refers to the calling card (Evidence 5), but the calling card is sent before the heist. However, the heist's calling card (Evidence 5) is addressed to Lordly Tailor, which matches the first part of the description. But Atmey sending his own card might not conflict. Not sure.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: "I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago." The exhibit's poster (Evidence 2) says the Sacred Urn was displayed there, so that's consistent.

Wait, another angle: Testimony 4 says he handled security himself to ensure his crime went smoothly. But Evidence 10 is a blackmail letter written by Bullard, found in Ron's room. If Bullard was blackmailing someone (maybe Atmey?), then Atmey's involvement in the murder might be linked. But that's more about motive than contradiction.

Wait, the key might be Testimony 5: "At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th." The evidence says the urn was found in his office (Evidence 4), so that's consistent. But if the paint was already there, then when he first touched it, he would have seen the paint, but that's not a contradiction. Hmm.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says he handled security himself. But Evidence 12's key card used by Ron's would mean Ron had access. So Atmey's claim of handling security himself contradicts the presence of Ron's key card being used. That's a possible contradiction between Evidence 12 and Testimony 4.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says he handled security himself to ensure his crime went smoothly. The crime here might refer to the theft, but the murder of Kane is separate. The key card's use at 1 AM (Evidence 12) might be related to accessing the CEO's office where Kane was killed. If Atmey was in control of security, but someone else (using Ron's key) accessed the office, that contradicts his claim of handling it himself.

So the contradiction would be between Evidence 12 (Key Card used by Ron's) and Testimony 4 (Atmey handled security himself). Therefore, the answer is {"evidence": 12, "testimony":4}.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony carefully.

First, looking at the characters, the main ones involved here are Luke Atmey, who is the defendant in this case, and Kane Bullard, the victim whose death is under investigation. The testimonies provided here are from Atmey himself, where he's trying to shift blame onto Kane Bullard.

The key here is to cross-reference each testimony with the evidence provided to find contradictions. Let's go through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict.

Testimony 0: Atmey claims he had no contact with the victim, Kane Bullard. But looking at Evidence 10, the Blackmail Letter was written by Bullard. If Bullard wrote the blackmail letter, that implies some form of interaction or at least knowledge between them. However, Atmey's testimony says he had no contact, but if the blackmail letter is from Bullard to Ron DeLite, maybe that's not directly about Atmey. Hmm, maybe not the best contradiction here yet.

Testimony 1: Atmey says Kane Bullard investigated Mask DeMasque and mistook who he was. Evidence 16, the Newspaper Clipping, mentions that Ron DeLite was the guard in the first heist. If Atmey is trying to say Bullard made a mistake in identifying Mask DeMasque, but the newspaper shows Ron was there, maybe that's part of the confusion. Not sure yet.

Testimony 2: Atmey claims Bullard wrote the blackmail letter and sent it to Ron. Evidence 10's Blackmail Letter is indeed written by Bullard. So this testimony aligns with the evidence, so no contradiction here. Wait, but the testimony says Bullard sent it to Ron. The evidence says the letter was found in Ron's room and written by Bullard, so that actually supports Atmey's testimony. So not a contradiction.

Testimony 3: Atmey says Bullard had a grudge against Ron for his betrayal. Evidence 10's blackmail letter mentions taking a red diamond if payment isn't made. If the betrayal is related to that, perhaps. But maybe there's another piece of evidence that contradicts this. Let me check others.

Testimony 4: Atmey says Bullard's mistake is excusable because Ron believed he was Mask DeMasque. Evidence 16 shows Ron was in the first heist's photo as the guard, so maybe Ron's claim of being Mask is contradicted by the newspaper showing he was the guard, not the thief. Wait, the newspaper clipping says the guard in the first heist's photo was Ron. So if Ron was the guard, he couldn't have been the thief (Mask DeMasque) at the same time. So if Atmey's testimony (Testimony 4) says Ron believed he was Mask DeMasque, but the newspaper shows he was the guard, that's a contradiction. Let me confirm:

Evidence 16's description says: "Guard in photo is Ron DeLite." So in the first heist, Ron was the guard, not the thief. But Testimony 4 from Atmey says Ron believed he was Mask DeMasque. That's a contradiction because the evidence shows Ron was the guard, not the thief. Therefore, Testimony 4 (which states Ron thought he was Mask) is contradicted by Evidence 16 (which shows he was the guard, not the thief).

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 5: Atmey says Ron killed Bullard because of the blackmail. But Evidence 15's autopsy report says Kane's death was from a blunt trauma, and Evidence 6 says DeMasque used the Shichishito to knock out Atmey, but the killer might be someone else. However, the main contradiction seems to be between Testimony 4 and Evidence 16.

Wait, let me recheck the exact wording:

Testimony 4: "That is why Mr. DeLite saw it fit to kill Kane Bullard. Truly a tragedy..." Wait no, Testimony 5 says that. Testimony 4 says: "Mr. Bullard's mistake is quite excusable. The defendant truly believes he is Mask DeMasque." The defendant here is Ron DeLite. So Atmey is saying Ron believes he is Mask DeMasque. But Evidence 16 shows that in the first heist's photo, Ron was the guard, not the thief. So the evidence contradicts the testimony that Ron believed he was the thief (Mask DeMasque), because he was actually the guard. Therefore, the testimony (Testimony 4) claims Ron thought he was Mask, but the evidence (Evidence 16) shows he was the guard, not the thief, so he couldn't have been Mask in that first heist. Therefore, that's a contradiction.

Alternatively, maybe another contradiction exists. Let's check other possibilities.

Looking at Testimony 5: Atmey says Ron killed Bullard because of the blackmail. But Evidence 15's autopsy shows Bullard's death was at 1 AM on 10/12. Evidence 19's buzzer record shows the buzzer was pressed at 1:02 AM that night. The Key Card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM that night. But Atmey's testimony about the motive might not directly conflict with any evidence. The main contradiction seems to be Testimony 4 and Evidence 16.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 2 says Bullard wrote the blackmail letter. Evidence 10 confirms that, so that's consistent. So the main contradiction is between Testimony 4 (Ron believed he was Mask) and Evidence 16 (Ron was the guard in the first heist, so he wasn't the thief then). Thus, the correct pair would be Evidence 16 and Testimony 4.

Wait, the user's instruction says to pick one pair. Let me make sure.

Yes, so the answer should be {"evidence":16, "testimony":4}.
</think>
